title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Hillel International (Boston, MA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a cover letter, I was contacted by a Hillel professional who told me that she would contact me before the interview to prepare me for the Zoom interview. That never happened. I was surprised to find that I was being interviewed by not one, but six people. After answering their questions for close to an hour, a development person popped into the call and began to ask me a bunch of other questions. By the end of the call, I DID not want the job. The committee told me they would get back to me about whether I would advance to the next stage -- a common courtesy. While I didn't want the job, I was surprised that there wasn't any follow-up, particularly since I sent them an email thanking them for their time.
Interview Questions: They asked standard questions, such as how I would deal with antisemitic matters on campus, my fundraising experience, etc. I think my values were more progressive than theirs. I shared that I hoped to create dialogue between Jewish and non-Jewish groups, and encourage them to participate in difficult conversations around race, gender, Israel, antisemitism, etc. to create greater understanding and awareness. This isn't a knock against Hillel -- I just don't think that this is their priority.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: I inquired about working at the front desk. I met with the head of operations and he asked me a few questions. He gave me a tour of the building and explained the role and responsibilities. It was an overall smooth process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in the Jewish community

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: I got interviewed by a phone call. During the interview, Hillel's manager questioned me about myself and explained about the job.  After that, I immediately started to work for the semester.
Interview Questions:
Can you tell me a little bit about yourself? 
How did you hear about this job?

title: IACT Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews - one with the Director and then one with the coworkers I would be working with if I got the job. The communication for the interviews was straight forward and the response times were timely.
Interview Questions: How would you bring your previous skills into this new position?

title: Business Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, a casual conversation. It was almost like just grabbing a coffee with someone. No trick questions. A very positive experience. A good tip - come in knowing where you'd like to see yourself in the next few years within Hillel itself.
Interview Questions: Q: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Springboard Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions:
Have interviewed for this position twice.  First time was 
 assured by interviewer that I did very well and should expect to be matched with a campus, but I was wait-listed and never heard back. Second time, I was also waitlisted. Both interviews went very well and I was definitely qualified. Matching process seems very mysterious. Overall positive experience but hiring process needs to be retooled IMO. Interviewers and recruitment team was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What does Innovation mean to you? (Innovation track)

title: Springboard Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: Long. First you have to interview with Hillel International's talent team. If you get through that, then you have to go through at least 3 interviews per campus. Then it is a matching process between the campus and the interviewee. If you do not match 1:1, you will start the whole process over.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about your Jewish experience
Were you involved in Hillel in college?
How would you engage a new student?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long and included many different stakeholders, including HQ, local lay leaders, students, the local "franchise" and financially supporting institutions. It took place over a 6-month period.
Interview Questions: How did I envision my role in terms of balancing fundraising, student support, and engaging with the university administration?

title: Engagement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying on the hillel international website, you then get a phone call with a recruiter from Hillel who helps you connect to your specific campus. While this is generally a springboard fellowship position, I applied from outside the program and was still offered an interview with the specific campus.
Interview Questions: If you had $10,000 for programming how would you spend it?

title: Engagement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled to last an hour but went a little over. I don't think the person interviewing me expected me to ask in depth questions. Interview was very standard. I would say my interview process was alright but they took over a month to get back to me and at that point I had already accepted something else.
Interview Questions:
Standard interview/college job questions. 
-Why do you want to work for Hillel
-What makes you a good fit
-Describe a time you disagreed with your supervisor and how you handled it 
-Describe a transformative college experience you had

title: Springboard Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International (New York, NY) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Three stepped and multi month long process that involved numerous questions from executive directors and HR professionals trying to see if this was work that we’d be into. We also got matched with schools in a ranking system and once you interview with each school then they make a final determination.
Interview Questions: Why Hillel and what we hoped to get out of it?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Hillel International (Boston, MA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: good becuase they were nice and the questions were fair and clear and they were nice and the questions were fiar and understandable to all,  though english is not my first language
Interview Questions: background and education and major in colege

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: I did two interviews, one lasted an hour, and one lasted 12 hours. After the 12 hour interview, I reached out, and didn't hear back for over a month. Although the staff was friendly, I felt that the team was disrespectful of my time and the process was drawn out.  After the 12 hour interview, I was told I'd hear from them by the following week. As noted above, it took them over a month to inform me of my application status.
Interview Questions: What Jewish experiences in your undergrad were most impactful on you & why?

title: Springboard Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted soon after I applied, had a video interview, then had an acceptance email a week or two later. I then reviewed the email, wrote my two matches and we set up interviews. Though I did not receive the job, I had a great Supervisor throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you failed the first time but succeed the second time?

title: Springboard Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Hillel International (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It's a really really long process and can require up to 25 interviews with different campuses and people at each campus. It's difficult to do while also in school but the job is worth the work! I think the process could be simplified but it's okay.
Interview Questions: Whats one program idea you have for a campus Hillel?

title: Engagement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions:
Three times now
Hour long phone call/ skype inital call.
Skype interview for about a half hour. I was told that they would get back to me the following week, I emailed, waited..
Told skills were perfect for position, just not at specific school, would have better luck next time
Interview Questions: What is your Jewish Journey?

title: Campus Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: It was an extremely smooth process. Hillel International is an exquisite organization. The people are extremely professional. Thoroughly enjoyed meeting them.  Overall, Hillel International is composed of all great people!
Interview Questions: Why Hillel?

title: Director, Program Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long and drawn out-- not a bad thing, but also felt that they need to be more respectful of our time. Generally positive, and they care a lot about the staff that they hire.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this job? What are some ideas of programs that you have?

title: Engagement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions:
-Apply online with cover letter and resume
-Skype Interview
-In-Person interview with director, associate director, ceo, staff panel and student panel

Very friendly interview process. Very accomodating. Mid-range difficulty with interview questions. Some expected, some unexpected. Overall, good experience.
Interview Questions: What is your Jewish story?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed first via skype with two current employees, followed by a skype interview with the chair of the Board of Trustees. Just two days later, I was invited to interview on campus the next week - with all expenses paid for. On campus, I spent approximately 8 hours interviewing - with Hillel staff, involved students, alumni, and other university professionals - including a college dean.
Interview Questions: What is one Jewish value that influences your working style, and how?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hillel International in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: skype interview for about a half hour. I was told that they would get back to me the following week, I emailed 2 weeks later and then was told I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: What would I bring to the job?

title: Engagement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called for a phone interview, a 2 hour luncheon with two students, and then a 1.5 hour interview with the directors. It was very long and unplanned, with students arriving late 30 minutes late and interviews running way over time. Looking back, it was a huge indicator of what my time as an Engagement Associate would be like.
Interview Questions: Do you think Jews are positively portrayed in the media?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: i am a student who was looking for a part time job, i applied for the position of marketing intern to create and brand events. had a short phone call and got the job
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hillel International
Interview Descriptions: Why leave your past job
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Hillel International (Washington, DC) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hillel uses Open Hire system.  Easy system for hiring manager to use, allows for fairly rapid and comprehensive communication turnaround.  Hiring done by hiring department, not HR
Interview Questions: Hillel uses example based questions - meaning they want you to have actual examples of scenarios in questions, and not answer in hypothetical
